channel.title: Predictive modeling on Sams Performance Training
channel.description: Recent content in Predictive modeling on Sams Performance Training

item.title: Individualized Athlete Monitoring in R, Part 3 (Interpreting the Predictive Model)
item.description: Hitting the Ground Running It’s Predicting Time Identifying Anomalies Wrapping Up Hitting the Ground Running This post assumes you’ve already read part 1 and part 2 for “Individual Athlete Monitoring in R.” If you haven’t I’d suggest you go back to part 2 for some context for this post. Otherwise, you’re going to be pretty lost. Let’s go. It’s Predicting Time Last time, we built a linear mixed model with the lme4 package called final model.

item.title: Individualized Athlete Monitoring in R, Part 2 (Building a Predictive Model)
item.description: Whoops A Refresher Anomaly Detection RM ANOVA vs. Mixed Modeling Building a Model Visualizing the Data Building the Model Wrapping Up Whoops Alright, so maybe I’m a liar and part 2 took…a while…to come to fruition. Sorry about that. In my defense, I’ve traveled to four different countries for work, worked on sprint step analysis for @DrBradDeWeese (hopefully we can share some of that soon), and bought a new laptop without any of my blogging packages installed so at least cut me a little slack.
